alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seminole, Lake, Orange, central Volusia and northwestern Osceola Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 311 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fruitland Park to 6 miles northeast of Emeralda to near DeLand to 6 miles northeast of Osteen. Movement was south at 20 mph. Numerous more thunderstorms are expected to develop over the Orlando Metro and Lake County over the next hour as outflow boundaries and the sea breeze collide. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Deltona, Kissimmee, Sanford and Apopka. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County
